title: Change kafka table provider properties structure.
body:
This is an intentionally breaking change in the kafka beam SQL table. Currently, using the kafka table provider is impossible with a single reference identifier (LOCATION), and the location field goes entirely unused. This change repurposes the currently unused LOCATION field to be `/`. This is a breaking change because previously, users could have had LOCATION set to any string they wanted, including those without the / structure, since this field was entirely unused. This change also changes "bootstrap.servers" which is a comma-separated string in the properties to "bootstrap_servers" which uses a proper array, and makes both the "topics" and "bootstrap_servers" parameters optional (previously, they were actually required, although the documentation said otherwise). Also update beam documentation to reflect new kafka, pubsub and pubsublite semantics added in this and previous PRs. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-11994] Update MetricsLogger, so that it does not reset the ProcessWide MetricsContainer.
body:
[BEAM-11994] Update MetricsLogger, so that it does not reset the ProcessWide MetricsContainer. This will clear legitimate process_wide metrics. Instead have the MetricsLogger calculate the deltas it wishes to log by storing a snapshot of the previously logged metrics. This is needed to enable the BigQueryIO process wide request count metrics. (Without this change my integration test was flakey, as the metrics were getting cleared during the test) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-12009] Implement Calc splitting rule.
body:
This borrows CalcRelSplitter from Calcite, with a couple modifications: - "The latest level should be CalcRelType otherwise literals cannot be implemented" https://github.com/apache/calcite/blob/8581f0a3fe9a4f079cb4d36f02121ae22118714c/core/src/main/java/org/apache/calcite/rel/rules/CalcRelSplitter.java#L395-L404 This restriction seems to be overly specific to Calcite's internal usage of CalcRelSplitter. Either Beam RelType can implement literals, so it doesn't matter what the latest level is. - "Sometimes a level's program merely projects its inputs. We don't want these. They cause an explosion in the search space." https://github.com/apache/calcite/blob/8581f0a3fe9a4f079cb4d36f02121ae22118714c/core/src/main/java/org/apache/calcite/rel/rules/CalcRelSplitter.java#L232-L237 This check causes failure for queries that don't read from a table. We create a dummy input row in Beam. This results in a BeamZetaSqlCalcRel being created that only reads that dummy input row. This check detects that the program is "trivial" and discards it. However, the next level then fails an assertion because it does not reference the dummy row. https://github.com/apache/calcite/blob/d9a81b88ad561e7e4cedae93e805e0d7a53a7f1a/core/src/main/java/org/apache/calcite/rex/RexProgram.java#L466 So basically this is a bug in the check. I'm not sure if there's a way to improve it so it works as intended, but removing it doesn't seem to hurt us any (not sure why this would cause an "explosion in the search space"; in our case, it just results in an extra ZetaSQL rel, which the planner cannot further optimize anyway). EDIT: see the individual commits for the complete list of changes to CalcRelSplitter. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9547] Add support for std and var to DataFrame
body:
This PR adds support for using the distributed `Series.std` and `Series.var` implementations from DataFrame. This works by: 1. Making `Series.agg('std')` defer to the specialized `Series.std` (and similarly for `var`). 2. Implementing `DataFrame.std` (and `var`) with `_agg_method`, which will leverage (1). title: [BEAM-11045] Avoid broken deps
body:
1. Updated dependency jupyter-client from ">=6.1.11,<7" to ">=6.1.11,<6.1.13" as the newest version 6.1.13 contains a bug https://github.com/jupyter/jupyter_client/issues/637 that breaks notebooks when getting messages. 2. This is caught by screen diff integration tests of interactive beam. 3. Added a timeout=-1 to allow indefinite wait for execution of each notebook cell in integration tests. The default value was 1 second. Instead of timeout each cell, moved the timeout to each test using pytest mark. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-12119] [BEAM-12122] Add integer and string `_id` keys support to Python IO MongoDB
body:
Usually, `ObjectId` is using for `_id` key, but sometimes you can deal with `int` and `str` keys. Reading from such MongoDB collection will raise errors: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-12122 This PR fix this: * handle **integer** and **string** `_id` keys when reading from MongoDB collections * RangeTracker defines by `_id` key type: `int` -> `OffsetRangeTracker` `ObjectId` -> `_ObjectIdRangeTracker` `string` -> `LexicographicKeyRangeTracker` * update `LexicographicKeyRangeTracker` to proper handling both `bytes` and `str` keys * make range_trackers.OrderedPositionRangeTracker.try_split() logic consistent with range_trackers.OffsetRangeTracker.try_split() * add unittests for MongoDB `_id` of `int` and `str` types * update `range_tracker_test` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-12136] Warn when using a deterministic fallback coder
body:
Deterministic coders are required by some transforms, such as for the key part of an element in a GroupByKey or CombinePerKey. The DeterministicFastPrimitivesCoder is adequate for most types, but if you get this warning it means that there might be a faster type-specific coder. Usually setting the proper type hint helps. https://beam.apache.org/documentation/sdks/python-type-safety/#use-of-type-hints-in-coders ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-12040, BEAM-11934] Remove the option withRunnerDeterminedShardingUnboundedInternal; add a check for merging windows

title: [BEAM-10854] Fix PeriodicImpulse for default values
body:
Fixing issue from BEAM-10854 and BEAM-11620, `PeriodicImpulse` would fail with default values. Some notes: - Lines [40-44] from `periodicsequence.py` could go directly in `PeriodicImpulse` (after line 162). But this would only fix `PeriodicImpulse` and would fail if other users decide to use `Timestamp` instead of `Float` for the times. - lines [92-96] of `periodicsequence_test.py`, adding this line would work to check if the default values would work both for `start` and `end`. This would avoid new errors in case the transform is modified. Those lines could be removed if needed ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-11777][BEAM-11978] Add support for all kwargs in DataFrame, Series aggregation methods
body:
This includes: - `level=`: which is essentially an alias for `groupby(level=)`, and we implement it as such - `numeric_only=`: which allows users to specify how to handle numeric aggregations for non-numeric columns (True=drop, None=try to coerce or drop, False=try to coerce and raise on failure) - `bool_only=` the same thing for boolean aggregations (all, any) over non-boolean columns. - `skipna=` drops NaNs before aggregating. - `min_count=` requires Singleton partitioning. Miscellaneous improvements included here: - `DeferredGroupBy.agg` now accepts string arguments. - `Deferred{DataFrame,Seres}.agg` now handle "liftable with sum" aggregations (BEAM-11978) Note the numeric aggregations (mean, sum, median, etc..) have an argument `numeric_only=` with the following behavior: - `True`: Just drop any column that doesn't have dtype int, float, or bool - `False`: Perform the aggregation on every column, raise an error if any are incompatible - `None` (default): Try to perform the aggregation, drop the ones that fail. `False` and `None` can do weird things like concatting a columns of Strings. With the the default `None` mode we would not know which columns will be present until observing all the data (non-deferred columns). That means we can't implement it faithfully in our model, where we need to know the dtypes at construction time. So I've added logic to raise a `WontImplementError` when performing a numeric aggregation on a DataFrame with non-numeric columns, _unless_ the aggregation was performed with `numeric_only=False`. We might consider adding similar logic for `bool_only`, which has the same behavior. However I think `bool_only=None` is much less risky, in general everything can be coerced into a boolean unless there's a column with `object` dtype containing objects where `__bool__` has been forbidden. title: [BEAM-12096] Attempt to fix flaky test
body:
1. Simplified the test to its barebone. 2. Added logging in the utils module in case there is ImportError. 3. Added pytest.mark.skipif in case unittest.skipIf is not working. 4. The assumption is that somehow the flaky runs are executed by a tox environment without necessary dependencies. The execution route silently fall into the NOOP route (we'll now see warning logs if flakiness happens again) and pytest doesn't skip the test. 5. The root cause can still be inappropriate usage of global singleton in the test environment. Thus added more Mocks to isolate the test from accessing attributes of the global singleton. ------------------------- Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-12040, BEAM-11934] Support session windows with WriteFiles runner determined sharding for unbounded data
body:
A follow-up PR for #14164. This PR tries to make the runner determined sharding implementation for unbounded data work with session windows. Before input -> group and batch -> write to temp files -> group files by destination -> finalize and rename After input -> GBK -> reify window -> group and batch -> write to temp files -> group files by {destination, window} -> finalize and rename As a comparison, fixed sharding implementation: input -> shard and GBK -> write to temp files -> reshuffle with void key -> gather bundles -> reshuffle -> finalize and rename ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable.
